title: Seeking publication of two Reports funded by Public Monies

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please provide in full copies of  two Reports  (and associated documents) created from Veale Wasbrough Vizards LLP at the instigation of Sheffield City Council:
1. The outcome of the formal complaint regarding the conduct of two Elected members - Cllrs Fox and Lodge;
2. The Report on the investigation into the Council's use of Undertakings in connection with the Sheffield Street Tree Dispute.
Publication of this material is in the public interest and there is no justification for continuing secrecy.
SCC claims to value scrutiny of its activities and to operate in an open and honest manner: in that context there is a clear benefit for all parties that the documents are shared with  citizens.
Yours faithfully,
Albert Thwiepp

Dear Albert Thwiepp,
Thank you for your request for information relating to two reports which
we received on 01/04/2025.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 01/05/2025. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Please note that from 1^st January 2025, as part of our commitment to
improving services, the council will accept FOI requests via the online
form which can be found here:
[1]Freedom of Information and Environmental Information requests |
Sheffield City Council
Please bookmark this link for future requests.
The online form is linked directly to our systems in the FOI service as
part of our continued improvement to streamline processes.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Albert Thwiepp,
Thank you for your request for information relating to two reports which
we received on 01/04/2025 and which is due to be answered today. We
apologise that we do not have a substantive response at this time. You
will appreciate these are complex and sensitive matters and we find that
we need more time to consider the public interest test in relation to an
exemption.
Therefore, under section 10(3) of the Freedom of Information Act 2000, we
are extending the deadline for compliance by another 20 days and our
response is due on 30^th May 2025. We understand this may be frustrating
and we would like to reassure you that we have not taken this step in
order to delay our reply. We have been unable to provide a response
because of the absence of key staff during the Easter period and will aim
to reply in full as soon as possible.
Yours sincerely,
FOI Team
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
